title: Comparing MCMC algorithms in Stochastic Volatility Models using Simulation Based Calibration
abstract: arXiv:2402.12384v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Simulation Based Calibration (SBC) is applied to analyse two commonly used, competing Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithms for estimating the posterior distribution of a stochastic volatility model. In particular, the bespoke 'off-set mixture approximation' algorithm proposed by Kim, Shephard, and Chib (1998) is explored together with a Hamiltonian Monte Carlo algorithm implemented through Stan. The SBC analysis involves a simulation study to assess whether each sampling algorithm has the capacity to produce valid inference for the correctly specified model, while also characterising statistical efficiency through the effective sample size. Results show that Stan's No-U-Turn sampler, an implementation of Hamiltonian Monte Carlo, produces a well-calibrated posterior estimate while the celebrated off-set mixture approach is less efficient and poorly calibrated, though model parameterisation also plays a role. Limitations and restrictions

translated_title: 在随机波动模型中比较MCMC算法使用基于模拟的校准
translated_abstract: 模拟基础的校准（SBC）应用于分析两种常用、竞争的马尔可夫链蒙特卡洛算法，用于估计随机波动模型的后验分布。具体来说，探讨了由Kim，Shephard和Chib（1998）提出的定制的“偏移混合逼近”算法，以及通过Stan实现的Hamilton蒙特卡洛算法。SBC分析涉及模拟研究，以评估每个采样算法是否能够为正确指定的模型产生有效推断，同时通过有效样本量来描述统计效率。结果表明，Stan的No-U-Turn采样器，即Hamilton蒙特卡洛的一种实现，产生了一个良好校准的后验估计，而备受赞誉的偏移混合方法效率较低，并校准不佳，尽管模型参数化也起着一定作用。
tldr: 通过模拟研究比较了两种常用MCMC算法对随机波动模型后验分布的估计效果，结果显示Stan的No-U-Turn采样器表现出良好的校准后验估计，而偏移混合方法效率较低且校准不佳。
en_tdlr: A comparison of two commonly used MCMC algorithms for estimating the posterior distribution of stochastic volatility models through simulation study revealed that Stan's No-U-Turn sampler produced a well-calibrated posterior estimate while the offset mixture approach was less efficient and poorly calibrated.
